title.native: ドラゴンボールZ 復活の「F」

description: One peaceful day on Earth, two remnants of Freeza's army named Sorbet and Tagoma arrive searching for the Dragon Balls with the aim of reviving Freeza. They succeed, and Freeza subsequently seeks revenge on the Saiyans.
synonyms: Dragon Ball Z: La Resurrección de "F"
Dragon Ball Z - La resurrezione di 'F'

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

title.native: ドラゴンボールZ: 神と神
ドラゴンボールZ 復活の「F」
銀河パトロールジャコ

name.native: ティリメンテンピボッシジャコ

alternative: Great Saiyaman 2 (グレートサイヤマン2号)

node.description:
He debuted in 1979 with the story [Wonder Island](https://anilist.co/manga/112596/Wonder-Island/), published in Weekly Shounen Jump, and first gained popularity for the anime and manga series [Dr. Slump](https://anilist.co/manga/30796/Dr-Slump/), originally serialized weekly in Shounen Jump from 1980 to 1984. In 1982, he won the Shogakukan Manga Award for Dr. Slump for best shounen or shoujo manga series of the year.  In 1984, Toriyama was responsible for developing [Dragon Ball](https://anilist.co/manga/30042/Dragon-Ball/) which was initially serialized in Weekly Shōnen Jump. It became an instant accomplishment—primarily selling over 35,000,000 copies in Japan, Dragon Ball eventually became a record-breaking best seller with over 120,000,000 copies sold. Aside from the Japanese fame, the series was equally successful internationally as well, including in Europe (1988), Canada (1996) and Latin America. Its success encouraged Toriyama to continue working on Dragon Ball from 1984 to 1995. During that eleven-year period, he produced 519 chapters, collected into 42 volumes. Each volume has an average of 200 pages. Moreover, the benefit of the manga led to three anime adaptations, numerous feature-length animated movies, several video games, and mega-merchandising. Toriyama's studio is called "Bird Studio", which is a play on his name, "tori" meaning "bird."

Toriyama married his wife [Yoshimi Kato](https://anilist.co/staff/311142/Nachi-Mikami) on May 2, 1982. She is a former manga artist from Nagoya under the pen name "Nachi Mikami" and occasionally helped Toriyama and his assistant on Dr. Slump when they were short on time. Together with his wife, he had two children: a son born in 1987, and a daughter born in 1990. He was a well-known recluse, who avoided appearing in public or media.

On March 8, 2024, it was announced that Toriyama passed away at the age of 68 from acute subdural hematoma.

name.native: マキシマムザホルモン

node.description: Striking contrasts from pop-punk to thrash-metal sum up the sound of the band. These various styles, expertly displayed through Daisuke and Ryo's screaming vocals, Ue's rhythmic slap bass, and the remarkable voice of Ryo's older sister and drummer, Nao, allow the band to fit well in several genres. The names and lyrics of their songs don't make a lot of sense, but the band doesn't want them to anyway.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/行信三)

Affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) since the early '80s.

Married to [Yukie Yuki](https://anilist.co/staff/135806/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/行信三)

Affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) since the early '80s.

Married to [Yukie Yuki](https://anilist.co/staff/135806/).

[Official Website](https://www.momoclo.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/momoclo_king_pr) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6YNWTm6zuMFsjqd0PO3G-Q)

Momoiro Clover Z (abbreviated Momoclo) is a four member idol girl group represented by Stardust Promotion under Section 3's 3Bjunior. The group was formed in 2008, originally under the name Momoiro Clover. The group gradually garnered popularity and fanbase following their single debut in 2009 and major debut in 2010.

They are known for their energetic and acrobatic performances, color-coded system and unconventional concepts. 

Their sister group is [Shiritsu Ebisu Chuugaku](https://anilist.co/staff/149421/Shiritsu-Ebisu-Chuugaku).

__[Website (Yuyoyuppe)](http://yuyoyuppe.com/)__ | __[Website (DJ'TEKINA)](http://djtekina.club/)__ | __[Blog](https://lineblog.me/yupeyupe/)__ | __[Twitter (Yuyoyuppe)](https://twitter.com/yupeyupe)__ | __[Twitter (DJ'TEKINA//SOMETHING)](https://twitter.com/TEKINASOMETHING)__ | __[Twitter (N.I.C.K)](http://shorturl.at/vDFK6)__ | __[Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/tekisome)__

__Introduction:__
Yuyoyuppe, alternatively known as DJ TEKINA//SOMETHING, otherwise known by nickname Yuppe is a Japanese DJ, vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger, remixer and member of the band Naked Identitiy Created by King (N.I.C.K), the band GRILLED MEAT YOUNGMANS and the creator unit [Heart's Cry](https://anilist.co/staff/252231/).

__Biography:__
He became involved in music activities for the first time when he was in high school, there he played the guitar and did the vocals for a band. Later on, when he discovered the now famous video uploading site Nico Nico Douga, he would start posting videos there himself. This would start in 2008, and he would upload mainly VOCALOID-type music meshed with loud rock colors. He gained immense popularity on the site and was even entered into the Nico Nico Douga hall of fame. He was particularly interested in a song titled "Hope", but because his lyrics made his feelings popular, he began to write lyrics that were far from fiction and closer to reality. This, he said, described himself.

He would later make a major debut on the album "Story of Hope", which would come ou on September 26 of 2012. Later on January 16 of 2013, the album "Wall in the presence -Yuppeism edition-" was released on the iTunes Store. Even later on July 16 of 2014, the album "Bokaro Holic" was released. While participating in the making of all of these albums, he was also in-charge of the vocals in the band My Eggplant Died Yesterday, though the band suspended in July of 2014. From this suspension, a new band would form, titled "GRILLED MEAT YOUNGMANS".

Yuyoyuppe has also been involved in the production of BABYMETAL's songs "ウ・キ・ウ・キ★ミッドナイト (Uki Uki ☆ Midnight)", "BABYMETAL DEATH", "メギツネ (Megitsune)", etc. He has also performed extensively, appearing at the ROCK IN JAPAN FESTIVAL and at the SUMMER SONIC, under the name "DJ'TEKINA//SOMETHING".

(Source: [Wikipedia (Yuyoyuppe)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%86%E3%82%88%E3%82%86%E3%81%A3%E3%81%BA), edited)
__Yukinojou Mori__ is a poet, lyricist and composer born in Tokyo, Japan. He is affiliated with Amuse.

[Twitter ](https://twitter.com/mth_ryo)

Ryou Kawakita, also known as Maximum the Ryou-kun, is the guitarist, songwriter and singer of Japanese metal band [Maximum the Hormone](https://anilist.co/staff/101206/Maximum-the-Hormone).

Ryou had played guitar since his years in junior high school. He was recruited into the band Maximum the Hormone by his sister Nao Kawakita after the departure of Key. His guitar playing is heavy and influenced by metal, punk, and hard rock bands including Tool, System of a Down, NOFX, The Ramones, Korn, Mr. Bungle, Pantera, Oasis, The Fall of Troy, Molotov, Cheap Trick.

Ryou made a guest appearance with Wagdug Futuristic Unity on "Systematic People", a track from Wagdug's Hakai album. "Systematic People" was also used as the opening theme for the anime series Kurozuka

[Twitter ](https://twitter.com/mth_ryo)
